description: The remains of an unknown female were discovered in a well shaft in Saskatoon's Sutherland neighbourhood in 2006. Now she has been identified as Alice Spence (nee Burke), a woman of Irish ancestry, about 35 years old at the time of her death.
title: Saskatoon police identify century-old remains of 'woman in the well' found in 2006

description: Burlington, Ont., student Evan Budz hopes his award-winning bionic turtle invention will help make underwater ecosystems safer and cleaner. He finished first among young scientists from 40 countries at a European Union contest, with a Calgary teen earning second.
title: Ontario teen wins EU contest for robotic turtle using AI to monitor aquatic ecosystems, coral health

description: Shopify merchants will soon be able to sell their products through ChatGPT, as the Canadian e-commerce software company says it has struck a partnership with U.S. tech giant OpenAI to make the sales possible.
title: Shopify merchants will soon be able to sell products through ChatGPT

description: Via Rail has announced it's postponing a pilot project that would have seen trains travel directly between Montreal and Toronto, skipping several eastern Ontario stops along the way.
title: Via Rail postpones direct Montreal-Toronto pilot

description: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre said Monday that Christians and their places of worship are being targeted and, if elected, he will crack down on religion-based hate.
title: Poilievre claims Christians 'may be the number 1' victims of hate-based violence
B.C. is expanding its involuntary care program. What does the treatment involve?

description: Police in Texas on Monday outlined how they linked a man connected to homicides in other states to the 1991 unsolved killings of four teenage girls at an Austin yogurt shop, saying DNA evidence led to a "significant breakthrough" in the brutal crime that has haunted the state's capital and stumped investigators for decades.
title: Texas police link deceased serial killer to 1991 yogurt shop killings of 4 teen girls

description: U.S. President Donald Trump hosted Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu for pivotal talks on Monday to press him to back a Gaza peace proposal aimed at ending a nearly two-year-old war that has seen Israel face growing international isolation.
title: Trump meets Netanyahu for Gaza peace talks

description: Parton was scheduled to perform six shows at The Colosseum at Caesars Palace between Dec. 4 and Dec. 13. She has rescheduled the dates for next September.
title: Dolly Parton postpones Las Vegas residency due to health challenges

description: Electronic Arts, maker of video games like Madden NFL, Battlefield and The Sims, is being acquired for $55 billion US, the biggest leveraged buyout attempt in history.
title: Video game giant Electronic Arts to be taken private in historic $55B buyout deal

description: The federal government announced a $400-million financial support for Algoma Steel under its large enterprise tariff relief scheme, Jobs Minister Patty Hajdu said on Monday.
title: Ottawa pledges $400M in financial aid for Algoma Steel as tariffs pummel sector

description: The largest employer in the northern Ontario city of Sault Ste. Marie is getting a half billion dollars in government loans — $400 million from Ottawa and $100 million from Ontario — to maintain its workforce in the face of U.S. tariffs.
title: Algoma Steel to get loans of $400M federally, $100M from Ontario as tariffs hit the industry

description: The federal government has listed the Bishnoi Gang as a terrorist entity, Public Safety Minister Gary Anandasangaree announced on Monday.
title: Federal government lists Bishnoi Gang as terrorist entity

description: A First Nations man convicted in the killing of a Winnipeg man more than 50 years ago is one step closer to having his name cleared following his own death in 2011, after Canada's justice minister ordered a new appeal in his case on Monday.
title: New appeal ordered for 4th First Nations man convicted in 1973 homicide, over a decade after his death

description: Rory McIlroy helped Europe win the Ryder Cup and then called out the hostile New York crowd for "unacceptable and abusive behaviour."
title: Rory McIlroy calls out 'unacceptable and abusive behaviour' from American fans at Ryder Cup

description: The Puerto Rican superstar's selection comes amid another career-defining run: He's fresh off a historic Puerto Rico residency this month that drew more than half a million fans, is leading all nominees at the Latin Grammys in November and is one of the world's most-streamed artists.
title: Bad Bunny will headline the 2026 Super Bowl halftime show

description: Cale Makar has difficulty recognizing the college hockey landscape in the wake of a seismic shift that has transformed the sport in the mere five years since he left UMass to join Colorado in the NHL.
title: NCAA rule change leads to Canadian Hockey League players making mass exodus to U.S. colleges

description: Namibia has sent more than 500 soldiers to help battle a huge wildfire that has burned across 30 per cent of the country's best-known national park, home to hundreds of species including the critically endangered black rhino.
title: Namibia's Etosha National Park, home to critically endangered black rhino, engulfed in huge fire

description: Heavy rain and strong winds from Typhoon Bualoi flooded roads, knocked off roofs and caused at least 12 deaths in central Vietnam, before weakening to a tropical storm that moved into Laos Monday, state media reported.
title: At least 12 dead in Vietnam from Typhoon Bualoi

description: The Saskatchewan government is apologizing to former students of the Île-à-la-Crosse Boarding School and has agreed to pay $40.2 million in restitution to them and their families.
title: Sask. apologizes, agrees to pay $40M to survivors of Île-à-la-Crosse residential school

description: Moldova's pro-European ruling party won a resounding victory over its Russian-leaning rival in a key parliamentary election, results showed on Monday, a major boost for the country's bid to join the European Union and break away from Moscow's orbit.
title: Moldova's pro-EU party wins election after campaign with Russian interference alleged

description: Some 2,000 workers are set to be laid off in January when General Motors cuts the third shift at its Oshawa, Ont., plant. Some are considering moving elsewhere, amid high unemployment rates in the city and an auto industry under threat from U.S. tariffs.
title: As GM job cuts loom in Oshawa, one man is preparing to leave the Ontario city he loves
How many wildfires are started by arson? Your questions, answered
Ontario's premier has a habit of weighing in on criminal cases. Some lawyers say he should be more careful

description: Provinces and territories are starting to roll out updated vaccines to protect people from COVID-19.
title: COVID-19 vaccine campaigns launch across Canada for 2025-26

description: The Wolastoqiyik Wahsipekuk First Nation was historically allotted the smallest reserve in Canada, but its leaders and members are building projects to unify the community that is spread out across Quebec.
title: First Nation on Canada's smallest reserve has big dreams, ideas for the future

description: Kiaira Fedorus has cerebral palsy, which severely limits her physical abilities on the right side of her body. When she became pregnant, she was terrified how it would affect her through pregnancy, childbirth and beyond.
title: I worried about being a mom with a disability. Now, I've embraced it — all with one hand

description: Montreal and other municipalities are dealing with big problems — not enough affordable housing, more people living on the streets and crumbling infrastructure. What can the next mayor actually do to fix them?
title: Montreal's next mayor faces big problems. How much power do they have to fix them?

description: Over the course of the 23-day journey, Gayle Uyagaqi Kabloona learned a lot about her family’s history. She also found the spot where her father was born on the land 76 years ago.
title: Ottawa-based artist retraces family's traditional 200-km migration route through Nunavut

description: With just days to go before the federal government stops funding hotel stays for asylum seekers, some Ottawa residents and community organizations are rolling up their sleeves to help their neighbours find stable housing.
title: Ottawans race against the clock to house asylum seekers ahead of federal hotel deadline

description: A shutdown of the U.S. government is looking all but inevitable and there’s growing concern the Trump administration is poised to use it as an opportunity to launch mass firings of federal employees.
title: Under Trump 2.0, this looming U.S. government shutdown looks different
